lines.text: All the woild loves a lover, but in this case, we'll make an exception.

[Looking up in the encyclopedia]
Q... R... S... T, Tas, Tasmanian. Here it is. "A strong, murderous beast, jaws as powerful as a steel trap - has ravenous appetite - eats tigers, lions, elephants, buffaloes, donkeys, giraffes, octopuses, rhinoceroses, mooses, ducks..."
Rabbits? It doesn't say rabbits here.
[Tasmanian Devil writes "and rabbits" on bottom of page]

[to a little fawn]
Hey, scram. Go on, beat it. The Tasmanian Devil's liable to get you. He's a mean, vicious, nasty, no-good, baggy-eyed, marble-headed ignoramorus. He's a stupid...
Flattery will get you nowhere. And you can't fool me again.
This bitsy little animal is made out of straw.
[growls at Bugs and takes off after him]
What for you bury me in the cold, cold ground?
